ai.summary: A challenging 21.7 km route in the UK that links three historic castles through varied countryside. The hike combines long distances, steep climbs, and rewarding views, designed for experienced walkers with solid navigation skills.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of rural lanes, field paths, and bridleways with uneven surfaces. Sections may be muddy or boggy after rain, and there are several steep ascents and long, open stretches. You’ll encounter hedgerows, gates, and occasional stiles, with variable visibility in rural areas.
ai.safety_notes: Prepare for a full-day hike on varied terrain with exposed sections. Wear sturdy boots and bring weather-appropriate clothing. Navigation can be challenging in remote stretches; carry a map, compass or GPS, and know your route. Respect private land and livestock when crossing farmland. Pack sufficient water and high-energy snacks, and have a means to signal for help (phone with coverage, whistle). Let someone know your itinerary and expected finish time. In adverse weather or poor daylight, consider postponing or shortening the route.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Water and high-energy snacks (2–3 liters water per person, plus extras in hot weather)
Weather-appropriate clothing (layering system, waterproof jacket, hat and gloves in cold weather)
Map and compass or GPS device
Phone with offline maps and emergency contacts
Headlamp or flashlight (for late finishes or low-light conditions)
Lightweight waterproof cover for your pack
Trekking poles (optional but helpful on uneven ground)
Waste bags to pack out litter
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are ideal for this long, exposed route. Summer provides the most daylight, but heat and sun exposure can be challenging; winter hikes are possible with proper gear but require careful planning due to shorter days and potential icy or muddy sections.

seo.title: Corvedale Three Castles Walk – 21.7 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Corvedale Three Castles Walk, a challenging 21.7 km route in the UK featuring varied terrain, hillier sections, and historic castles. Suitable for experienced hikers.
